00043 
00044 /*
00045 Class: Songbird
00046 
00047 The Songbird object provides several pieces of functionality to your web page: playback,
00048 download, listener adding and removing and library creation and retrieval.
00049 
00050 This object provides you with functions that enable you to initiate playback
00051 of URL's, <MediaLists> and <WebPlaylists>. Basic playback control functions are also
00052 provided.
00053 
00054 The Songbird object provides download functionality as well. You may use it to download
00055 <MediaItems>, <MediaLists> and user selected items present in the <WebPlaylist>.
00056 
00057 The Songbird object is accessible (from Javascript) using the "songbird" global variable attached
00058 to the currently loaded document. See the example below.
00059 
00060 Example:
00061 (start code)
00062 //Get the currently playing artist.
00063 var artist = songbird.currentArtist;
00064 
00065 //Create default library with current domain and path automatically guessed.
00066 //This is the suggested way to create your site library.
00067 var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00068 
00069 ... // Look up the artist in your web service database
00070 ... // Find some samples by that artist.
00071 
00072 var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem(url);
00073 
00074 //Create a simple media list.
00075 var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00076 
00077 //Add a mediaitem to it.
00078 list.addItem(mediaItem);
00079 
00080 //Play it.
00081 songbird.playMediaList(mediaList);
00082 
00083 //You may also want to trigger a download to the users machine, for this mediaitem.
00084 songbird.downloadItem(mediaItem);
00085 (end)
00086 
00087 See Also:
00088   For more information about the <MediaItem> object, see the <MediaItem> reference.
00089   For more information about the <MediaList> object, see the <MediaList> reference.
00090   For more information about the <WebPlaylist> object, see the <WebPlaylist> reference.
00091 */
00099 [scriptable, uuid(40964944-5243-4a16-886b-14c1cbaa79d9)]

00167 
00168   This is the playing state of the application. If stopped this will be false,
00169   otherwise this will be true. If the application is paused this will be true
00170   so for a complete status you need to check the paused state as well.
00171 
00172   Type:
00173     boolean
00174   */

00185   Prop: paused
00186 
00187   This is the pause state of the application. This will be true if the
00188   application has been paused during playback. It will be false if not
00189   paused or stopped.
00190 
00191   Type:
00192     boolean
00193   */
00194   readonly attribute boolean paused;

00205   /*
00206   Prop: repeat
00207 
00208   The repeat state for playback. This can be one of three values:
00209     0 - no repeat
00210     1 - repeat the current track forever
00211     2 - repeat the current playlist forever
00212 
00213   Type:
00214     integer
00215   */
00216   readonly attribute long long repeat;

00311   /*
00312   Func: addListener()
00313 
00314   Add a listener to get notified of changes to Songbird metadata and state.
00315 
00316   Prototype:
00317     addListener(String key, Object listener)
00318 
00319   Parameters:
00320     key - The key for the metadata or state value.
00321     listener - The listener that will get called when the metadata or state value specified by the key changes.
00322 
00323   Example:
00324     (start code)
00325     //Make a listener object. The listener must always have at least this function.
00326 
00327     //You may add any number of functions and properties to it for your own use.
00328 
00329     //Make sure to save this object somewhere so you may unregister it when you are done
00330     //listening for changes.
00331     var listener = {
00332       observer: function(subject, topic, data) {
00333       }
00334     }
00335 
00336     var key = "metadata.genre";
00337 
00338     songbird.addListener(key, listener);
00339 
00340     ...
00341 
00342     songbird.removeListener(key, listener);
00343     (end)
00344 
00345   See Also:
00346     <removeListener()>
00347 
00348     Visit <http://some/other/part/of/documentation/> for a list of keys for metadata and state.
00349 
00350     Visit <http://www.xulplanet.com/references/xpcomref/ifaces/nsIObserver.html> for nsIObserver interface reference.
00351   */
00352   void addListener( in AString aKey,
00353                     in nsIObserver aObserver );
00354 
00359   /*
00360   Func: removeListener()
00361 
00362   Remove a listener that was previously added using <addListener>.
00363 
00364   Prototype:
00365     removeListener(String key, Object listener)
00366 
00367   Parameters:
00368     key - The key for the metadata or state value.
00369     listener - The listener that was previously added using <addListener>.
00370 
00371   Example:
00372     (start code)
00373     //This example assumes there was a listener object named 'listener' that was previously
00374     //created and added using the key 'metadata.genre'.
00375 
00376     ...
00377 
00378     var key = "metadata.genre";
00379     songbird.removeListener(key, listener);
00380     (end)
00381 
00382   See Also:
00383     <addListener()>
00384 
00385     Visit <http://www.xulplanet.com/references/xpcomref/ifaces/nsIObserver.html> for nsIObserver interface reference.
00386   */
00387   void removeListener( in AString aKey,

00393   /*
00394   Func: downloadItem()
00395 
00396   Download a <MediaItem>. <MediaList>s and <Library>ies not allowed.
00397 
00398   Prototype:
00399     downloadItem(<MediaItem> mediaItem)
00400 
00401   Parameters:
00402     mediaItem - The <MediaItem> to download.
00403 
00404   Example:
00405     (start code)
00406     //Create or get library.
00407     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00408 
00409     //Create the mediaitem.
00410     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00411 
00412     //Download the mediaitem to the users local machine.
00413     songbird.downloadItem(mediaItem);
00414     (end)
00415 
00416   See Also:
00417     <downloadList()>
00418     <downloadSelected()>
00419   */

00426   /*
00427   Func: downloadList()
00428 
00429   Download a <MediaList>. As <Library>ies are <MediaList>s they are
00430   allowed here.
00431 
00432   Prototype:
00433     downloadList(<MediaList> mediaList)
00434 
00435   Parameters:
00436     mediaList - The <MediaList> to download.
00437 
00438   Example:
00439     (start code)
00440     //Create or get site library.
00441     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00442 
00443     //Create mediaitem.
00444     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00445 
00446     //Create medialist to download.
00447     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00448 
00449     //Add item to medialist.
00450     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00451 
00452     //Download the medialist.
00453     songbird.downloadList(mediaList);
00454     (end)
00455 
00456   See Also:
00457     <downloadItem()>
00458     <downloadSelected()>
00459   */

00520 
00521   Begin playback of a <MediaList> at the specified index in the list.
00522 
00523   Prototype:
00524     playMediaList(<MediaList> mediaList, Number index)
00525 
00526   Parameters:
00527     mediaList - The <MediaList> to play.
00528     index - Where to start playing in the list. Index starts at 0.
00529 
00530   Example:
00531     (start code)
00532     //Songbird object implements Player.
00533     //Play the media list, starting with item at index 2.
00534 
00535     player.playMediaList(mediaList, 2);
00536     (end)
00537

00539     <play()>

00693   /*
00694   Func: siteLibrary()
00695 
00696   Access to a sitelibrary for the given domain and path. If you wish to create
00697   your library with the default domain and path (which reflect your page's current domain and path)
00698   use an empty string for the domain and the path.
00699 
00700   If a library was already created for the domain and path, the existing library will be returned.
00701 
00702   Prototype:
00703     siteLibrary(String domain, String path)
00704 
00705   Parameters:
00706     domain - The domain name of the library. This may be an empty string.
00707     path - The path within the domain for the library. This may be an empty string.
00708 
00709   Returns:
00710     The requested <Library> object or null.
00711 
00712   Example:
00713     (start code)
00714     //Create a library. This is the preferred way to create your site library.
00715      var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00716     (end)
00717   */
00718   sbIRemoteLibrary siteLibrary(in AUTF8String aDomain, in AUTF8String aPath);

00725   Prototype:
00726     libraries(String libraryID)
00727 
00728   Parameters:
00729     libraryID - Library ID you wish to access, this can be a path or 'magic' keyword.
00730 
00731   Example:
